## Acceptance Criteria

Documentation is complete when:
- [ ] All required topics are covered

## Style and Format

**Documentation Standards:**
- [ ] Follow existing documentation style
- [ ] Use clear, concise language
- [ ] Include practical examples
- [ ] Add links to related docs
- [ ] Use consistent formatting

**Sections to Include:**
- Overview/Introduction
- Prerequisites
- Step-by-step instructions
- Examples
- Common issues/FAQ
- References

## Testing Documentation

**Verification Steps:**
- [ ] All code examples run successfully
- [ ] Commands produce expected output
- [ ] Links are valid
- [ ] Spelling and grammar checked
- [ ] Screenshots/diagrams are up-to-date

**How to Test:**
```bash
# Verify code examples work
python example_from_docs.py
```

**For GitHub Copilot:**
When writing documentation:
1. Be clear and concise
2. Test all code examples with real verification
3. Use consistent terminology with existing docs
4. Include practical, working examples
5. Update related documentation files
6. Follow repository documentation style
